intro: Vittadinia australis var. tenuissima, commonly known as the slender vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Its narrow, linear leaves and small yellow flowers make it a distinctive species within its genus. It is generally herbaceous, with a low-growing habit and is often found in open habitats.
